reviews.review_msg: I took his class a while ago and love the way he teaches. His notes and lectures are very clear and he also gives very good examples. My friends took the same class thought he is good too. I am a bit surprised with the others' comments. Small sample size, I guess!

Mumbles, useless notes, spend too much time on unimportant, easy material that we already know and none on the more difficult stuffs. The midterms are fairly easy, but the final is wtf. It's all due to him not having time to teach the last half of the material. But I think at the end he curves the grade. Feel like learn nothing from his class.

He does NOT know how to teach. I don't know why SFU is letting graduate students to teach a 300 level course. His notes are useless, exams way off the material. His review classes are a joke. He cannot speak clearly. He cannot write clearly. Such an inexperienced teacher. Please don't take a class with him.

No Cheat sheets! Likes to mumble and expects you to just magically understand stuff on the spot. Makes alot of mistakes while writing down notes on the overhead (If you've ever had swartz and read his hand writing, wait until you see this guy's!). On review day spends 30 min going over expectation of univariate & multivariate zomg. N00b

Dr. Wang is a nice person but lecture is kind of boring. She gave 5% bonus as long as you finish the participation quiz. She is very happy to help if you have questions. Midterms are closely related to samples. This course is hard in nature, and extremely focus on math. Final exam is very difficult, be prepared to study hard to get a good grade.

The course structure wasn't great. The first 10 weeks covered trivial concepts at an extremely slow pace and the last three weeks were crammed with way more complex concepts. There are minimal practice questions available. The final was terribly structured, only testing maybe 10% of what we learned in the semester.

For a stats course that is very heavy on the math, she ain't the worst prof to have. The textbook isn't really worth reading, just follow her provided lecture notes. Though I do have to say, the final was absurd in difficulty compared to everything else in the course..
Amazing professor. Cares about student's success.
good prof

Her exams are very straightforward if you manage to understand her lecture notes and examples.  If not, the textbook is quite helpful as well.  Midterms were both really easy, final was a bit more difficult (but mainly due to its length and not the questions themselves).  Moderately easy to do well; finished with an A+
Great lectures and pretty straightforward exams/no big curveballs.
a good prof, and he;s always ready to help his students. exams are well related to the course notes.

I have strong respect to his knowledge. I was fortunate enough to be the only attendant of his office hours. His is easy-going, knows everything about his course and stat and even the way to study. Every one should have met such professor at his/her early age to help make decision on study and even carrer. Exams are fair.
Great prof! he teaches the material realli slow and clear, it is just that he speaak so soft and it is realli hard to hear what he said. MTs are easy, but final is hard!
He's like a high school teacher.
Nice....I Got A+
He Rocks!!!!!
excellent prof, really care student's understanding of material, easy course
Very Good teacher
Good teacher
No Comments
long lecture, confusing teaching style, lots of assignment, hard exam. she will not make you have better understanding of what you should learn, the only words she will tell you is practice more.
She is nice actually. This course includes lots of materials. Her exams are  a little bit tricky but generally it is not hard.

take this prof for 330 if u get the chance. she gives many opportunities for you to boost ur mark if u did poorly in exams. the class did poorly on 2nd midterm so she shifted the weight away to 1st midterm where everybody did well. she also provides a bomb ass cheat sheet for exams.  michelle is so based. god bless.
